results.title: Deep sea trawler
results.brief_description: Part of the “Man and his world” series, this film describes a trawler’s voyage from its home port on the North Sea to the Grand Banks off Newfoundland. Shows the complete operation of catching and processing the fish.

results.title: Deep hearts
results.creator_credit: Robert Gardner and Harvard University. Film Study Center
results.brief_description: About the Bororo Fulani of the Niger Republic in Africa. The Bororo are a nomadic tribe, moving with their cattle across the Sahel desert each year to gather in large numbers at certain watering places to celebrate their vision of themselves as chosen beings and to enjoy one another’s company. Dressed in ceremonial attire, they celebrate the yearly rains by singing and dancing.

results.title: Deep-sea container ports
results.brief_description: “Summary: the first half of the film takes a general look at containerization and its impact on the ports, and on the international freight transport system, how it has streamlined and mechanized the system. the seco

results.title: Deconstructing Harry. Mighty Aphrodite
results.brief_description: Mighty Aphrodite (1995): Writer-director Woody Allen plays Lenny, a sportswriter who is dissatisfied in his marriage to art dealer, Amanda. Lenny becomes obsessed with locating his adopted son’s natural mother, feeling convinced that she will be a brilliant and intelligent person. Instead she’s Linda, a ditzy porn star and prostitute. Despite the initial disillusionment, Lenny soon develops a fondness for Linda, and decides to help her get her life back on track. Cast includes: Woody Allen, Mira Sorvino, Helena Bonham Carter, Michael Rapaport, F. Murray Abraham, Olympia Dukakis and Peter Weller. Deconstructing Harry (1997): Harry (Woody Allen), a New York author, has just released his latest novel, “loosely” based on the characters from his own life - his ex-wives, mistresses, family and analysts. No-one likes his depiction of them, and in an hilariously ironic mixture of flashbacks to his new novel, flashbacks to his past, and mishaps in the present, the true story comes out. In classic Allen style, this autobiographical story is a fascinating mixture of fiction and reality. The cast is another line-up of characters in itself,including Kirstie Alley, Demi Moore, Robin Williams, Billy Crystal, Elisabeth Shue, Stanley Tucci, Amy Irving, Julie Kavner, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Mariel Hemingway and Judy Davis.

results.title: Decisive discipline: every move you make
results.creator_credit: Bill Rogers and Institute of Educational Administration
results.brief_description: A kit produced by Bill Rogers and the Institute of Educational Administration which advocates certain decisive discipline strategies which could be utilised by a classroom teacher. The kit consists of two videotapes and an accompanying booklet which provides background information and print summaries from the videotapes. Highlights some classroom discipline problems and strategies for dealing with them.

results.title: Decisions
results.creator_credit: Stephen Judson and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description: Covers a variety of situations requiring decision-making ranging from the simple to the complex. Outlines practical procedures and psychological aspects such as anxiety, self-doubt and the fear of being wrong. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Decision Australia
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Bank of New South Wales and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: A promotional film aimed at British residents. Shows an English family who have applied to emigrate to Australia under the Assisted Passage Scheme. Shows the many attractions of Sydney.

results.title: Decent exposure
results.brief_description: Numerous paintings and sculptures escape from the National Gallery and start terrorising the streets of Melbourne. “The Expert” who encouraged the artworks to escape in order to expose themselves to the public then puts himself on the campaign trail. Features the filmclip “Keep on trying”.

results.title: Decade for action
results.brief_description: A report on the United Nations Development Decade which aims to replace labour intensive production methods in third world nations in an attempt to liberate people from hunger and poverty. Focuses on innovative international efforts that have harnessed the energy generated by the sun, wind and water and transformed it into power. By applying these technological achievements and injecting capital, the UN believes it may alleviate many of the hardships endured by underdeveloped nations. Includes a segment on the development of the Volta River Dam.

results.title: Debs
results.brief_description: In the Republic of Ireland, the “Debs” dance marks the end of school days, a romantic night to remember, which represents the transition from childhood to maturity. The reality, however, is often an expensive evening of heartbreak or alcoholic excess, culminating in the exhausted and dispirited youths trailing through the down streets of Dublin in their bedraggled finery. This look at teenage ritual is explosively portrayed by youngsters from the Dublin Youth Centre.
